He retired from professional chess in 1975 and became increasingly reclusive and controversial in his later years. Fischer passed away in 2008 at the age of 64, leaving behind a complex and enigmatic legacy as one of the most influential and revolutionary figures in the history of chess.

Piketty's data-driven approach to analyzing economic trends has earned him numerous accolades, including the Yrjö Jahnsson Award in Economics and the Legion of Honour in France. Advocating for policies that address the growing wealth gap, Piketty calls for a global wealth tax to tackle wealth inequality, sparking important debates and influencing policymakers and academics worldwide. He styled himself as a larger-than-life figure, adopting grandiose titles like 'Conqueror of the British Empire' and 'Last King of Scotland.' Overthrown in 1979, Amin fled into exile in Saudi Arabia, where he lived until his death in 2003, proclaiming himself the 'Conqueror of the British Empire' and adopting the title of 'His Excellency, President for Life, Field Marshal Al Hadji Doctor Idi Amin Dada, VC, DSO, MC, Lord of All the Beasts of the Earth and Fishes of the Seas and Conqueror of the British Empire in Africa in General and Uganda in Particular.'

input: Tell me a paragraph bio of Michael Collins (astronaut).

input: Tell me a paragraph bio of Huang Xing.
output: Huang Xing, born in 1874 in Hunan province, emerged as a prominent Chinese revolutionary leader and military commander who played a pivotal role in the overthrow of the Qing dynasty. A close associate of Sun Yat-sen, Huang Xing was instrumental in organizing the revolutionary forces for the Wuchang Uprising in 1911, marking the beginning of the Xinhai Revolution that led to the establishment of the Republic of China. Serving as the commander-in-chief of the National Revolutionary Army and the first commander-in-chief of the Republic of China's armed forces, Huang Xing demonstrated strong leadership, strategic vision, and unwavering dedication to the cause of revolution. He was a founding member of the Kuomintang and founded the Chinese Revolutionary Alliance, leaving behind a legacy as a patriotic hero and key figure in China's transition from imperial rule to republican government. Despite facing obstacles and challenges, Huang Xing remained committed to his revolutionary ideals until his passing in 1916, being remembered as one of the founding fathers of modern China and a fearless patriot.
